TopicTitle: Im going to take a break from KSP. For a while.

Articles.Content:
I'm going to take a break from KSP.  This may make some mad but the reason is is just that. I have other things to focus on. I will still be active on the forums but Im going to take a break from KSP. For a few months or until KSP2 comes out. For those who follow my channel, my channel will be dead for a bit. 

Thanks for understanding. I'm just kerbal-ed out. And orbital mechanics boggle my mind. 
 

Im playing Kerbal again. Can’t keep my self away from it.

Edited September 23, 2021 by Dr. Kerbal
There is nothing wrong with taking a break, or anything for anyone to be mad about.  If you do anything for too long you stand a good chance of burning out. C-ya when you decide to come back

Aw, it’s always good to see your stuff here! Well, better this then get burned out. Take care Doc!! Miss ya already

3 hours ago, Dr. Kerbal said:

I will still be active on the forums but Im going to take a break from KSP. For a few months or until KSP2 comes out.

No problems at all Doc, you know that I do try friendly banter with you from time to time but in no way am I mad. I can't imagine why anyone would be but if they are then don't let it weigh you down. Think of their anger as water off a duck's back.

 

Everyone does what they have to do, and all YouTubers take breaks for months at a time. You stay frosty and I hope to see you ... LOUNGING around ... soon!

3 hours ago, Dr. Kerbal said:

 And orbital mechanics boggle my mind. 

Hey, I understand totally. I've learned more about orbital mechanics and spaceflight playing this game than I ever thought possible. It still boggles my mind but it is kind of neat that now I can listen to some of the ESA/NASA/JPL press briefings and actually understand what they are talking about. This is one of the reasons I think Kerbal Space Program succeeds - it is educational and fun and demanding, all at the same time.

3 hours ago, Dr. Kerbal said:

I'm going to take a break from KSP.  This may make some mad but the reason is is just that. I have other things to focus on...

I'm just kerbal-ed out.

Everyone reaches that point with even their most favorite games. Even now, I've reduced the amount of time I play Kerbal Space Program from about 30 hours a week to about five hours a week. Not because I am bored with the game or don't like the game. But over the past few months, it's been full speed ahead, working on various KSP projects. Always remember, you do not need anyone's permission to step away from the game. And don't let yourself feel guilty when you do have to step away from it.

3 hours ago, Dr. Kerbal said:

I will still be active on the forums...

Yes, this. Of all the gaming forums I belong to, this is by far, my favorite.

Anyhow, don't feel guilty. Enjoy life. Even when fun becomes work, then fun isn't fun anymore. Go have fun!
See you in a few months then!
I haven’t played KSP in quite awhile actually, but this forum is my first stop when surfing (so easy to get addicted to seeing red dots in the top right corner)
